org.jcvi.jillion.core.residue

Interface ResidueSequenceBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<S>, Iterable<R>, SequenceBuilder<R,S>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NucleotideSequenceBuilder, ProteinSequenceBuilder

    public interface ResidueSequenceBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
extends SequenceBuilder<R,S>

      • insert

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> insert(int offset,
                                   String sequence)
        Inserts the given sequence to the builder's mutable sequence starting at the given offset. If any residues existed downstream of this offset before this insert method was executed, then those residues will be shifted by n bases where n is the length of the given sequence to insert. If the offset = the current length then this insertion is treated as an append.
        Parameters:
        offset - the GAPPED offset into this mutable sequence to begin insertion.
        sequence - the nucleotide sequence to be inserted at the given offset.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset is invalid.

        Get the current length of the mutable sequence not counting gaps in the sequence.
        Returns:
        the current length of the nucleotide sequence.

        Replace the residue at the given offset with a different nucleotide.

      • delete

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> delete(Range range)
        Deletes the nucleotides from the given range of this partially constructed residue sequence. If the given range is empty, then the residue sequence will not be modified. If the range extends beyond the currently built sequence, then this will delete until the end of the sequence.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface SequenceBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
        Parameters:
        range - the range to delete can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if range's start is negative or greater than this residue sequence's current length.

      • getNumGaps

        int getNumGaps()
        Get the number of gaps currently in this sequence.
        Returns:
        the number of gaps; will always be ≥ 0.

      • prepend

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> prepend(String sequence)
        Inserts the given sequence the beginning of the builder's mutable sequence. This is the same as calling insert(0,sequence)
        Parameters:
        sequence - the residue sequence to be inserted at the beginning.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.
        See Also:
        insert(int, String)

      • insert

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> insert(int offset,
                                   Iterable<R> sequence)
        Inserts the given sequence to the builder's mutable sequence starting at the given offset. If any residues existed downstream of this offset before this insert method was executed, then those nucleotides will be shifted by n bases where n is the length of the given sequence to insert.
        Parameters:
        offset - the gapped offset into this mutable sequence to begin insertion. If the offset = the current length then this insertion is treated as an append.
        sequence - the residue sequence to be inserted at the given offset.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset lt; 0 or > current sequence length.

      • insert

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> insert(int offset,
                                   ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> otherBuilder)
        Inserts the contents of the given other ResidueSequenceBuilder into this builder's mutable sequence starting at the given offset. If any residues existed downstream of this offset before this insert method was executed, then those residues will be shifted by n bases where n is the length of the given sequence to insert. Any further modifications to the passed in builder will not be reflected in this builder. This is an equivalent but more efficient operation as this.insert(offset, otherBuilder.build()). If the offset = the current length then this insertion is treated as an append.
        Parameters:
        offset - the gapped offset into this mutable sequence to begin insertion.
        otherBuilder - the ResidueSequenceBuilder whose current residues are to be inserted at the given offset.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if otherBuilder is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset lt; 0 or > current sequence length.

      • insert

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> insert(int offset,
                                   R base)
        Inserts the given Residue to the builder's mutable sequence at the given offset. If any nucleotides existed downstream of this offset before this insert method was executed, then those nucleotides will be shifted by 1 base. If the offset = the current length then this insertion is treated as an append.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface SequenceBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
        Parameters:
        offset - the GAPPED offset into this mutable sequence to begin insertion.
        base - the Residue to be inserted at the given offset.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if base is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset lt; 0 or > current sequence length.

      • prepend

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> prepend(Iterable<R> sequence)
        Inserts the given sequence the beginning of the builder's mutable sequence. This is the same as calling insert(0,sequence)
        Parameters:
        sequence - the residue sequence to be inserted at the beginning.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.
        See Also:
        insert(int, Iterable)

      • prepend

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> prepend(ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> otherBuilder)
        Inserts the current contents of the given ResidueSequenceBuilder to the beginning of this builder's mutable sequence. This is the same as calling insert(0,otherBuilder)
        Parameters:
        otherBuilder - ResidueSequenceBuilder whose current nucleotides are to be inserted at the beginning.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if otherBuilder is null.
        See Also:
        insert(int, ResidueSequenceBuilder)

      • build

        S build()
        Create a new instance using the data collected by this builder thus far.

        Create a new Sequence instance from the current mutable elements. This method does not destroy any temp data so this method could be called multiple times each time creating a new Sequence.

        Create a new ResidueSequenceBuilder instance from the current mutable residues. This method does not destroy any temp data so this method could be called multiple times each time creating a new ResidueSequenceBuilder.

        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<S extends Sequence<R>>
        Specified by:
        build in interface SequenceBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
        Returns:
        a new residue Sequence never null but may be empty.

      • trim

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> trim(Range range)
        Modify the current sequence to keep only that the sub sequence within the given Range. If the range extends beyond the current sequence, then this will keep all the residues until the end of the sequence.
        Specified by:
        trim in interface SequenceBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
        Parameters:
        range - the range of residues to keep (gapped).
        Returns:
        this.

      • copy

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> copy()
        Create a new deep copy instance of the Builder. Any downstream modifications to either this Builder or the returned one are independent of each other.
        Specified by:
        copy in interface SequenceBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
        Returns:
        a new SequenceBuilder that contains the same state as this builder; will never be null.

      • toString

        String toString()
        Get the current Residues as a String.

        toString in interface SequenceBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • reverse

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> reverse()
        Reverse but not complement all the residues currently in this builder. Calling this method will only reverse residues that already exist in this builder; any additional operations to insert residues will not be affected.

        For example if this builder had the sequence "AAGG" then after this method is called the resulting sequence would be "GGAA".

        Specified by:
        reverse in interface SequenceBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
        Returns:
        this.

      • ungap

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> ungap()
        Remove all gaps currently present in this builder.
        Returns:
        this.

      • turnOffDataCompression

        ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S> turnOffDataCompression(boolean turnOffDataCompression)
        Turn off more extreme data compression which will improve cpu performance at the cost of the built Sequence taking up more memory. By default, if this method is not called, then the data compression is turned ON which is the equivalent of calling this method with the parameter set to false.
        Parameters:
        turnOffDataCompression - true to turn off data compression; false to keep data compression on. Defaults to false.
        Returns:
        this.
        Since:
        5.3
